subject: Programming
title: Pointers and Memory Addresses
description: One-minute skill: Pointers and Memory Addresses.

hook.text: Every byte in your computer's memory has a unique address â€” like a house number on a street.

buildup.text: A pointer is a variable that holds a memory address instead of a value.

discovery.text: Pointers let programs share data without copying it. One address can link distant parts of memory.

twist.text: Dangling pointers and null references cause more crashes than almost any other kind of bug.

climax.text: Tony Hoare called his invention of the null reference a 'billion-dollar mistake.'

punchline.text: The most powerful tool in memory is also the most dangerous.

quiz.question: What did Tony Hoare call the null reference?
